SEARCH
Package gw.api.web.tools

Class Duration

java.lang.Object
gw.api.web.tools.Duration
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Duration>
public class Duration extends Object implements Comparable<Duration>
A class to hold, compute, and display durations between two Date objects.

  • Constructor Summary

    Duration(Date startTime, Date endTime)
    Duration constructor that takes in a start time, end time but uses the current system clock to set the current time.

    See Duration(Date, Date).

  • Constructor Details

    • Duration

      public Duration(Date startTime, @Nullable Date endTime)
      Duration constructor that takes in a start time, end time but uses the current system clock to set the current time.
      Parameters:
      startTime - The start time
      endTime - The end time, will use the system clock for the ending duration if this value is null

    • Duration

      public Duration(Date startTime, @Nullable Date endTime, Date now)
      See Duration(Date, Date). But allows users to specify a custom current time
      Parameters:
      startTime - The start time
      endTime - The end time
      now - The current time

  • Method Details

    • getDisplayString

      public static String getDisplayString(long totalSeconds)
      Utility method to convert a duration in seconds to a displayable string.
      Parameters:
      totalSeconds - length of time in seconds
      Returns:
      A formatted display string

    • getDisplayString

      public String getDisplayString()
      Returns:
      A human readable string based on the start time and end/current time.

    • getTextFormat

      public String getTextFormat(String daysFormat, String hoursFormat, String minutesFormat, String runningMessage, boolean running)
      A method that allows for custom text formats
      Parameters:
      daysFormat - Custom format for days. Default: "Day(s)"
      hoursFormat - Custom format for hours. Default: "Hour(s)"
      minutesFormat - Custom format for minutes. Default: "Minute(s)"
      runningMessage - Custom running message
      running - Append a custom running message to the end of the string
      Returns:
      A human readable string for the duration

    • getTextFormat

      public String getTextFormat(String daysFormat, String hoursFormat, String minutesFormat, String runningMessage)
      A method that allows for custom text formats. Running message will be appended if the endTime is null
      Parameters:
      daysFormat - Custom format for days. Default: "Day(s)"
      hoursFormat - Custom format for hours. Default: "Hour(s)"
      minutesFormat - Custom format for minutes. Default: "Minute(s)"
      runningMessage - Custom running message
      Returns:
      A human readable string for the duration

    • getTextFormat

      public static String getTextFormat(String daysFormat, String hoursFormat, String minutesFormat, String runningMessage, long totalSeconds, boolean running)
      A utility method to format an arbitrary amount of seconds into a human readable duration with custom formats.
      Parameters:
      daysFormat - Custom format for days. Default: "Day(s)"
      hoursFormat - Custom format for hours. Default: "Hour(s)"
      minutesFormat - Custom format for minutes. Default: "Minute(s)"
      runningMessage - Custom running message
      totalSeconds - A length of time in seconds to convert into a text duration.
      running - Append a custom running message to the end of the string
      Returns:
      A human readable string for the duration

    • getTotalSeconds

      public long getTotalSeconds()
      Returns:
      Amount of time between the end and start times in seconds.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Duration o)
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Duration>

    • shortFormatMillisecs

      public static String shortFormatMillisecs(long millisecs)
      Returns a formatted string with the duration expressed down to the millisecond
      Parameters:
      millisecs - - the duration of the period in milliseconds
      Returns:
      the formatted string

    • shortFormatSeconds

      public static String shortFormatSeconds(long seconds)
      Returns a formatted string with the duration expressed down to the second
      Parameters:
      seconds - - the duration of the period in seconds (milli / (1000)
      Returns:
      the formatted string

    • shortFormatMinutes

      public static String shortFormatMinutes(long minutes)
      Returns a formatted string with the duration expressed down to the minute
      Parameters:
      minutes - - the duration of the period in minutes (milli / (1000 * 60)
      Returns:
      the formatted string

    • shortFormatHours

      public static String shortFormatHours(long hours)
      Returns a formatted string with the duration expressed down to the hour
      Parameters:
      hours - - the duration of the period in minutes (milli / (1000 * 60 * 60)
      Returns:
      the formatted string

    • shortFormatDays

      public static String shortFormatDays(long days)
      Returns a formatted string with the duration expressed down to the days
      Parameters:
      days - - the duration of the period in minutes (milli / (1000 * 60 * 60 * 24)
      Returns:
      the formatted string
